item.title: Markov Matrices and Fourier Series
item.description: 21.1 Markov Matrices Markov Matrices have the following properties: All entries $\geq 0$ Sum of the entries in a column equal $1$ A markov matrix will always have an eigenvalue of $1$. Apart from this, all other eigenvalues will be $\leq 1$. Let us consider the difference equation $u_k = A^ku_0$ where we represent $u_0$ as the combinations of eigenvectors, i.e. $u_0 = c_1x_1 + c_2x_2 + … + c_nx_n = Sc$.
